paper_abstract: An adaptive control scheme combined with backstepping radial basis function (RBF) neural networks is proposed for the output tracking control problem of a class of MIMO nonlinear systems with input delay and disturbances Neural networks are employed to estimate the unknown continuous functions The control scheme ensures that the closed-loop system is semi-globally uniformly ultimately bounded (SGUUB) The tracking error is proved to be bounded and ultimately converges to an adequately small compact set The feasibility is investigated by a simulation example (C) 2010 Elsevier B V All rights reserved
paper_title: Adaptive tracking control for input delayed MIMO nonlinear systems
